humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor. In this report, the left breast has a tumor size of 0.9 x 0.7 x 0.5 cm, which would correspond to a T1 tumor. However, the right breast has a much larger tumor size of 12.5 x 6.3 x 2.2 cm, which corresponds to a T3 tumor. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T3, as it is based on the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is primarily based on the size of the primary tumor and whether it has invaded nearby structures. In this report, the left breast shows an infiltrating lobular carcinoma that forms a 0.9 x 0.7 x 0.5 cm mass (T1). However, the right breast has a much larger infiltrating lobular carcinoma, forming a 12.5 x 6.3 x 2.2 cm mass, which involves multiple quadrants (T3). Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T3.
